------=_Part_0_1083350704.1359540851707
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi everyone!

I'm new to this group and new to web archiving.

I'm studying Media Preservation and for a project I try to save a few websites using Heritrix. It generally works really fine.

But some websites really give me a headache, because the layout won't work. The images are all there, the Css files are also saved, but it won't show the defined frames! The content is just lined up, one below the other, instead of beneath or above each other. 

I already raised the number of MaxTransHops and SpeculativeHops and it worked for a number of websites, but not for this.

One of the websites is http://www.landesarchiv-bw.de.

Maybe you can give me some advice?
It would be very appreciated!

Thanks in advance,

Steph
------=_Part_0_1083350704.1359540851707
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<p>Hi everyone!</p>
<p>I'm new to this group and new to web archiving.</p>
<p>I'm studying Media Preservation and for a project I try to save a few websites using Heritrix. It generally works really fine.</p>
<p>But some websites really give me a headache, because the layout won't work. The images are all there, the Css files are also saved, but it won't show the defined frames! The content is just lined up, one below the other, instead of beneath or above each other. </p>
<p>I already raised the number of MaxTransHops and SpeculativeHops and it worked for a number of websites, but not for this.</p>
<p>One of the websites is <a href="http://www.landesarchiv-bw.de">http://www.landesarchiv-bw.de</a>.</p>
<p>Maybe you can give me some advice?<br>
It would be very appreciated!</p>
<p>Thanks in advance,</p>
<p>Steph</p>

------=_Part_0_1083350704.1359540851707--
